item.title: 防务装备制造商萨博第一季度营业利润增长 28
item.description: 瑞典防务设备制造商萨博公司周五报告称，第一季度营业利润增长了 28%，并上调了全年有机销售增长预期。【原文：Swedish defence equipment maker Saab reported on Friday a 28% rise in operating profit for the first quarter and raised its organic sales growth outlook for the full year.】

item.title: 人头马君度第四季度销售额好于预期
item.description: 干邑生产商人头马君度（Remy Cointreau）周五公布第四季度销售额下降 0.7%，远高于分析师预期的下降 3.4%。【原文：Cognac maker Remy Cointreau reported a 0.7% decline in fourth-quarter sales on Friday, well ahead of analyst expectations for a 3.4% fall.】

item.title: 北京车展：主题和亮点
item.description: 中国最大的车展在北京开幕，各大汽车厂商展示了最新的电动汽车（EV），彰显了这个全球最大的汽车市场已经进入了纯电动时代，并且不会回头。【原文：China's largest auto show opened in Beijing with the biggest names showing off their latest electric vehicles (EVs), underlining how the world's largest auto market is already in an all-electric state of mind, and isn't looking back.】

item.title: 美国通胀忧虑加剧，投资者为 5%的国债收益率做好准备
item.description: 随着对美国通胀的担忧加剧，一些投资者正准备让 10 年期美国国债收益率突破去年 10 月创下的 5%的 16 年高点。【原文：As U.S. inflation worries grow, some investors are preparing for the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield to breach a 16-year high of 5% hit last October.】

item.title: 赛峰集团第一季度收入增长，保持财务目标不变
item.description: 法国喷气发动机制造商赛峰集团公布第一季度收入同比增长18.1%，并重申了今年的财务目标，同时与其美国合作伙伴通用电气航空航天集团（GE Aerospace）一起下调了发动机交付目标。【原文：French jet engine maker Safran posted an 18.1% year-on-year increase in first-quarter revenue and reaffirmed financial targets for the year, while joining its U.S. partner GE Aerospace in lowering a target for engine deliveries.】

item.title: 由于亚洲合资公司的贡献，Amundi 第一季度资金流入超出预期
item.description: 欧洲最大的基金管理公司 Amundi 上周五公布的第一季度资金流入情况好于预期，这主要得益于其在亚洲的合资企业，以及对风险规避型产品的持续青睐，从而支撑了管理资产 9.4% 的年增长率。【原文：Amundi , Europe's biggest fund manager, posted better-than-expected first-quarter inflows on Friday thanks to its joint ventures in Asia and continued appetite for risk-averse products that underpinned 9.4% yearly growth of assets under management.】

item.title: 越南推迟推出新股票交易系统
item.description: 越南国家证券委员会（SSC）表示，原定于下周推出的备受期待的新股票交易系统将推迟推出。【原文：Vietnam will delay the launch of the much-expected new stock trading system initially slated for next week, its State Securities Commission (SSC) said.】

item.title: K-pop 巨头 HYBE 与 NewJeans 唱片公司纠纷不断，股价再遭重挫
item.description: 韩国一位因创建流行 K-pop 团体 NewJeans 而备受赞誉的音乐高管否认了有关她试图让自己的公司脱离 HYBE 的指控，而 HYBE 正是轰动全球的 BTS 的发源地，这导致这家 K-pop 巨头的股价周五暴跌。【原文：A South Korean music executive credited with creating popular K-pop group NewJeans denied allegations that she was trying to break her label away from HYBE, home to global sensation BTS, sending the K-pop giant's shares tumbling on Friday.】

item.title: 早间竞价阅读日本央行的茶叶
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 特斯拉的平价汽车计划借鉴了底特律竞争对手的经验
item.description: 在一些特斯拉投资者和分析师看来，埃隆-马斯克的新计划是利用现有产品线作为新的经济型汽车的基础，而不是推出全新车型。【原文：Elon Musk's new plan to use current product lines as the basis for new affordable vehicles — rather than springing for all-new models — follows the playbook of Tesla's old-school Detroit rivals, as some Tesla investors and analysts see it.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会文件显示，前高管巴格里诺出售价值 1.815 亿美元的特斯拉股票
item.description: 据美国证券交易委员会周四提交的一份文件显示，特斯拉前高管德鲁-巴格里诺（Drew Baglino）已出售了这家世界顶级电动汽车制造商价值约 1.815 亿美元的股票。【原文：Former Tesla executive Drew Baglino has sold shares worth around $181.5 million in the world's top EV maker, according to a SEC filing on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本央行维持利率稳定，调整日本国债购买计划
item.description: 日本央行周五维持其短期利率稳定，同时取消了对其每月大致承诺购买的政府债券数量的提及。【原文：The Bank of Japan kept its short-term rates steady on Friday while removing a reference to the amount of government bonds it has roughly committed to buying each month.】

item.title: 香港 3 月房价上涨 1.1%，近一年来首次上涨
item.description: 3 月份，香港私人住宅价格扭转了连续 10 个月的下跌趋势，比 2 月份攀升了 1.1%，此前这个金融城市取消了抑制措施，以提振萎靡不振的房地产市场。【原文：Hong Kong's private home prices reversed a 10-month falling streak in March, climbing 1.1% from February, after the financial city lifted curbs to boost the ailing property market.】

item.title: 日本央行维持利率稳定，预计未来几年通胀率将保持在 2% 附近
item.description: 日本央行周五维持利率不变，并发布了新的估计，预计未来三年通胀率将保持在2%的目标附近，这表明日本央行准备在今年晚些时候提高借贷成本。【原文：The Bank of Japan kept interest rates unchanged on Friday and issued fresh estimates projecting inflation to stay near its 2% target in the next three years, signalling its readiness to hike borrowing costs later this year.】

item.title: 北京市将补贴国产人工智能芯片，目标到 2027 年实现自给自足
item.description: 北京市政府宣布为购买国产人工智能（AI）芯片的企业提供补贴，中国正努力发展半导体产业，减少对外国技术的依赖。【原文：Beijing city authorities have announced subsidies for firms that purchase domestically produced artificial intelligence (AI) chips, as China seeks to develop its semiconductor industry and reduce reliance on foreign technology.】

item.title: 关注日本央行决议，亚洲股市和日元走势暂缓
item.description: 亚洲股市周五谨慎上扬，因为市场清醒地认识到美国降息很可能还需要一段时间，而日元和日本政府债券则在日本央行备受关注的政策决定出台前挣扎。【原文：Asian shares rose cautiously on Friday as markets sobered up to the idea that U.S. rate cuts were most likely some time away, while the yen and Japanese government bonds struggled ahead of a closely watched policy decision by the Bank of Japan.】

item.title: 惠誉：韩国公共财政不再是信用评级的 "强项
item.description: 全球评级机构惠誉（Fitch）表示，韩国的公共财政不再是其主权信用评级的优势，而现在是一个中性因素，需要在短期内努力控制债务的增加。【原文：South Korea's public finances are no longer a strength for its sovereign credit rating but are now a neutral factor requiring near-term efforts to contain the rise in debt, global ratings agency Fitch said.】

item.title: 美国官员缓解市场对经济逆风的担忧，油价上涨
item.description: 周五早盘，油价上涨，原因是市场评估了美国财政部长的言论，即美国经济状况可能比疲软的第一季度数据所显示的更强劲，再加上中东冲突仍在继续，市场对供应存在担忧。【原文：Oil prices rose in early trade on Friday, as players took stock of the U.S. Treasury secretary's comments that the country's economy is likely in a stronger position than indicated by weak first-quarter data, coupled with supply concerns as conflict continues in the Middle East.】

item.title: 日本央行召开会议，日元创数十年来最弱水平
item.description: 在日本央行召开会议之前，日元兑美元创下 34 年新低，兑其他货币的汇率也创下十年新低。【原文：The yen was parked by a 34-year low on the dollar and decade lows on other crosses ahead of a Bank of Japan meeting where interest rates are expected to stay low, while the dollar dipped elsewhere on softer-than-expected U.S. growth data.】

item.title: 今年下半年全球经济将继续保持良好态势：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，全球经济很可能在今年下半年乃至 2025 年继续保持稳健的增长势头，一反此前对经济放缓的预期。【原文：The global economy is likely to carry its solid momentum for the rest of the year and into 2025, defying earlier expectations of a slowdown, according to a Reuters poll of economists who said stronger growth than forecast was more likely than weakness.】

item.title: 财政部长：日本担心日元疲软的负面影响
item.description: 日本财务大臣铃木俊一周五表示，由于日元今年持续下滑，他担心日元疲软会带来负面影响。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Friday he is concerned about negative effects of the weak yen as the currency has continued to slide this year.】

item.title: 出价 390 亿美元收购竞争对手英美资源集团后，必和必拓股价下跌 4
item.description: 必和必拓集团周五股价下跌 4%，这是该公司在澳大利亚上市后的首个交易日，因为该公司透露将出价 388 亿美元收购规模较小的竞争对手英美资源集团（Anglo American），这笔交易将使该公司成为全球最大的铜矿商。【原文：BHP Group shares fell 4% on Friday in the first day of trading of its Australian-listed stock since revealing a $38.8 billion bid for smaller rival Anglo American in a deal that would forge the world's largest copper miner.】

item.title: 日本首都通胀放缓超预期，低于日本央行目标
item.description: 周五的数据显示，日本首都四月份的核心通胀率放缓幅度远超预期，低于央行设定的2%的目标，这使得央行决定何时加息变得更加复杂。【原文：Core inflation in Japan's capital slowed much more than expected in April and fell below the central bank's 2% target, data showed on Friday, complicating its decision on how soon to raise interest rates.】

item.title: 日本央行可能通过新的物价预测发出近期加息信号
item.description: 日本央行周五将预测未来几年通胀率将保持在2%的目标附近，并表示准备将利率从接近零的水平上调，希望阻止日元熊市将日元推向34年来的新低。【原文：The Bank of Japan on Friday is set to project inflation will stay near its 2% target in coming years and signal its readiness to raise interest rates from near-zero, in hope of keeping yen bears from pushing the currency to fresh 34-year lows.】

item.title: 房地产需求旺盛，韦尔豪瑟公司季度利润超出预期
item.description: 由于住房建设需求增加，美国林产品公司韦尔豪瑟周四公布的第一季度利润超出预期。【原文：U.S. forest product firm Weyerhaeuser on Thursday beat estimates for first-quarter profit on increased demand for housing construction.】

item.title: Capital One 第一季度利润因利息收入增加而大幅增长
item.description: Capital One Financial 第一季度利润增长了 35%，原因是在利率上升的情况下，客户对该公司的信用卡贷款支付了更多的费用。【原文：Capital One Financial's first-quarter profit rose 35% as customers paid more on the company's credit-card loans amid higher interest rates.】

item.title: 早间竞价：日本央行居中，美国科技股支撑
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国液化天然气需求激增，一家工厂却在努力维持运转
item.description: 金融公司 LSEG 的数据显示，由于技术问题，美国第二大液化天然气（LNG）出口设施的运行率一直低于其产能的 80%，从而影响了美国的出口。【原文：The second-largest U.S. liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facility has been running below 80% of its capacity due to technical problems, data from financial firm LSEG showed, denting U.S. exports.】

item.title: Cigna 将在专科药房提供共付额为 0 美元的 Humira 竞争产品
item.description: 美国医疗保险公司 Cigna 周四表示，该公司计划从 6 月起通过其专科药房向符合条件的美国患者提供艾伯维公司的关节炎特效药 Humira 的近似复制品，患者无需自付费用。【原文：Cigna plans to make close copies of AbbVie's blockbuster arthritis drug Humira available with no out-of-pocket payment to eligible patients in the U.S. using its specialty pharmacy beginning in June, the health insurer said on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔玛前董事长罗布-沃尔顿将退出董事会
item.description: 沃尔玛周四表示，罗布-沃尔顿将在 6 月 5 日任期结束后从这家大型零售商的董事会退休。【原文：Walmart said on Thursday that Rob Walton would retire from the board of the big-box retailer at the end of his term on June 5.】
